question: A 2 kg mass is attached to a spring with a spring constant of 50 N/m. If the mass is displaced 20 cm from equilibrium and released, what is the period of oscillation of the mass-spring system?
solution: The period of a mass-spring system can be found using the formula T = 2π√(m/k), where m is the mass and k is the spring constant. Plugging in the given values: T = 2π√(2 kg / 50 N/m) = 2π√(0.04 s^2) ≈ 1.26 s. The closest answer choice is C, 1.3 s. Note that the amplitude of oscillation (20 cm in this case) does not affect the period.
